intro: Psychotria bimbiensis, commonly known as the "Bimbi's Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves with smooth margins and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Psychotria bimbiensis is often used in traditional medicine and is also of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in its native habitat.
